intro: Thiseltonia, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plants typically grow in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Thiseltonia species have alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and their flowers are arranged in composite heads. They are known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies.
